revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-02 17:24:41.000000000', 'files': ['tests-py3.txt', 'nova/tests/unit/matchers.py'], 'message': 'Enable python34 tests for nova.tests.unit.virt.libvirt.test_config*

With python34, some of the unit tests were passing bytes instead of strings
to XMLMatches which was causing six.StringIO() to report failure:
TypeError: initial_value must be str or None, not bytes

The fix is to convert the bytes to a proper string.

Note: Python27 evaluates isinstance(str, bytes) to True even for a string.  For
this reason we first exclude strings in the condition and then evaluate if it
is bytes.

Change-Id: Ic2252132b0a8b9f4fc35b00186c533b942de789f
PartiallyImplements: blueprint nova-python3-newton
'}]
commit_message:
Enable python34 tests for nova.tests.unit.virt.libvirt.test_config*

With python34, some of the unit tests were passing bytes instead of strings
to XMLMatches which was causing six.StringIO() to report failure:
TypeError: initial_value must be str or None, not bytes

The fix is to convert the bytes to a proper string.

Note: Python27 evaluates isinstance(str, bytes) to True even for a string.  For
this reason we first exclude strings in the condition and then evaluate if it
is bytes.

Change-Id: Ic2252132b0a8b9f4fc35b00186c533b942de789f
PartiallyImplements: blueprint nova-python3-newton

commit_message:
Stop configuring neutron to enforce DHCP MTU option

Since Mitaka, Neutron does the right job to calculate and advertise
correct MTU to instances, out of the box.

Change-Id: I119cf3c2bf5fc7b6f7f049381b85a6b1c3aa8779
(cherry picked from commit 273cef616db46abacc87be58692b1629ee744426)

Add a 'resources pre_create phase' so that we can create the neutron
network earlier in the process and then allow Ironic to also have a
pre_create step to use the network and perform actions on it before it
is used by nova in the 'create phase'

commit_message:
Add a 'resources pre_create phase'

Add a 'resources pre_create phase' so that we can create the neutron
network earlier in the process and then allow Ironic to also have a
pre_create step to use the network and perform actions on it before it
is used by nova in the 'create phase'

For projects/50_neutron/resources.sh move what was in the 'create'
step to the 'pre_create' step.

Change-Id: I046e25a698be154ae22208bb50690ec5a615c611

    siganture (signature)

commit_message:
Change keystone admin/internal insecure flags

Make `keystone_service_internaluri_insecure` and
`keystone_service_adminuri_insecure` flag default values
derived from facts like protocol each endpoint is using and
kind of certificates being used to reach that endpoint
(user-provided or self-signed).

Combined backport of:
 - 2ffb77638f48d75a444c35e619355cd6f1339076
 - 8387b680f7724b80ff9cf4b4577e6a7afbd15322

Change-Id: I921031c676776884cb121a7914fcd9c505345e67
Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>
Closes-Bug: 1566629

Previously when we had one repo with one alembic branch we would

multiple repos and expand/contract branches for each repo.
So from now on we tag the final revision on every branch when we make

Since no new migration scripts were added during the Mitaka cycle

Change-Id: I720f1089dc725f8e3856725a6a4334115a44cd24

commit_message:
Tag the alembic migration revisions for Mitaka

Previously when we had one repo with one alembic branch we would
create a milestone revision on that single branch. Now we have
multiple repos and expand/contract branches for each repo.
So from now on we tag the final revision on every branch when we make
a milestone release.

Since no new migration scripts were added during the Mitaka cycle
in networking-l2gw, this patch adds the tag in Liberty expand
and contract scripts.

Change-Id: I720f1089dc725f8e3856725a6a4334115a44cd24
Closes-Bug: #1581158

commit_message:
Put back missing sysmeta unit tests

We lost some unit tests from test_sysmeta.py in [1].
This patch restores them. Since the proxy no longer
implements post-as-copy or COPY then we need to plumb
in a copy middleware to the test app in test_sysmeta.

It is a little odd perhaps to have these tests under
test/unit/proxy but the alternative is to duplicate
the test setup and base test code that already exists
in test_sysmeta.py into test_copy.py.

[1] commit 46d61a4dcd9a5d9157625c06d6fe7d916e80c3d2
    (server side copy middleware)

Change-Id: Iec02387ccbddbe3841a417880389c707cd5c0346

commit_message:
Update documentation to use native APIs

The documentation needs updating after removing the Magnum APIs for
creating containers, rcs, services and pods. The documentation in
quickstart.rst now covers how to generate cert and sign certs for
authenticating with Kubernetes using the native Kubernetes API for
launching the redis example.

Change-Id: I5cb6459963f34812f2067e2c0952d06079080782

commit_message:
Enable TLS support for k8s CoreOS

* Add cloud-init to generate TLS certificates in each node.
* Modify coreos fragments to point to the path of certificates.
* Add support for "--tls-disabled" to turn off TLS.
* Use Keystone trust to retrieve TLS certificates.

Implements: blueprint tls-for-coreos-bay
Change-Id: I66842f9374abe5a9bbf275fa130c0eae3e6065ab

Start the initial work to ensure that callers creating a RequestContext
object will do so with keyword arguments. The benefit of this is that
there is no confusion about what arguments are being used.

Previously callers could make a call like:
  ctx = RequestContext(None, 'user', None, 'example.com')

This change is the first step in requiring the callers to specify each
argument using a keyword.

Added unit tests for change.

commit_message:
WIP: Enforce clarity by using keyword-only arguments

Start the initial work to ensure that callers creating a RequestContext
object will do so with keyword arguments. The benefit of this is that
there is no confusion about what arguments are being used.

Previously callers could make a call like:
  ctx = RequestContext(None, 'user', None, 'example.com')

This change is the first step in requiring the callers to specify each
argument using a keyword.

Added unit tests for change.

TODO: Figure out how to do logging to warn developers to fix their code
to use keyword arguments if they are using plain args.

Change-Id: I70a351e1025c21663c155423e517bd384cca6d02

commit_message:
Add console.html summary and viewer

This adds a new console.html summary and details view that can
gives overview information about console output, organizes output
by section, and can also determine the currently running script at
job failure time. The console viewer is a CodeMirror-based widget
that provides basic highlighting and folding capabilities to make
console output easier to browse.

Change-Id: I27a9a532ae117d2914dc2f3a866c780378e79f72

remove verbose option in devstack plugin

This option is deprecated in Mitaka and has been removed in Newton,
and its default value is True already. Let's remove it.

other tests in race conditions. Use a mechanism for overwriting
config options (self.flags and self.override_config methods of TestCase).

Change-Id: I97c58c08104e4da6f3f0386d9396224e71461856
'}]
commit_message:
Replace manually changing CONF options

Changing config parameters by one test can lead to wrong behavior
other tests in race conditions. Use a mechanism for overwriting
config options (self.flags and self.override_config methods of TestCase).

Change-Id: I97c58c08104e4da6f3f0386d9396224e71461856

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-20 18:34:42.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/hpe/hpe_3par_iscsi.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_hpe3par.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/hpe/hpe_3par_fc.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/hpe/hpe_3par_common.py'], 'message': "3PAR: Remove metadata that tracks the instance id

HPE added some additional tracking of the instanced ID metadata on the
3PAR storage arrays back in Icehouse. When a volume was attached, the
instance ID was stored on the 3PAR and removed on detach.
Initially this this was over SSH and moved to REST calls due to
performance issues. Many customers still have issues with this unused
feature on upgrades and under heavy load.

The tracking of the instance ID is no longer required by HPE and has no
affect on any of the Cinder functionality. This unused feature will also
be a problem when multi-attach lands, so it's being removed by this

Change-Id: Ic181e6598f37a727b41c093e0c09abe229183d6f
Closes-Bug: #1572665
"}]
commit_message:
3PAR: Remove metadata that tracks the instance id

HPE added some additional tracking of the instanced ID metadata on the
3PAR storage arrays back in Icehouse. When a volume was attached, the
instance ID was stored on the 3PAR and removed on detach.
Initially this this was over SSH and moved to REST calls due to
performance issues. Many customers still have issues with this unused
feature on upgrades and under heavy load.

The tracking of the instance ID is no longer required by HPE and has no
affect on any of the Cinder functionality. This unused feature will also
be a problem when multi-attach lands, so it's being removed by this
patch.

Change-Id: Ic181e6598f37a727b41c093e0c09abe229183d6f
Closes-Bug: #1572665

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-12 21:01:08.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/scenario/runners/user_actions_runners.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/runners/database_actions_runners.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/runners/test_runners.py'], 'message': 'User and database tests wait for casted actions

User and database actions like create, delete and update
are guestagent casts. The tests cannot reliably assume
they would be completed once the client call returns
(especially on datastores other than MySQL).

Add methods to wait for listing changes after the above actions.

Change-Id: Ic84b028e67ce19fb9297ebcacd2aafa6fd058d43
'}]
commit_message:
User and database tests wait for casted actions

User and database actions like create, delete and update
are guestagent casts. The tests cannot reliably assume
they would be completed once the client call returns
(especially on datastores other than MySQL).

Add methods to wait for listing changes after the above actions.

Change-Id: Ic84b028e67ce19fb9297ebcacd2aafa6fd058d43

commit_message:
Extract manifests and astute.yaml sync to be ASAP

This fix ensures that any plugins can run even if
their tasks depend on pre-deployment stage. This fix
puts plugins/manifests rsync and astute.yaml upload
even earlier than pre-deployment stage. Otherwise it
would put burden on plugin developers to update old versions
of their plugins to do things after pre-deployment-end
which makes no sense.

Change-Id: I6c36ac4aef027ef4560b20f9f5a697ddb361b9e3
Partial-bug: #1572276

subject: stop managing eventlet service on RedHat
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-12 20:49:38.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/keystone_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp'], 'message': "stop managing eventlet service on RedHat

RedHat packaging dropped the eventlet service (openstack-keystone) so we
no longer need to manage it (we used to stop the service before starting
httpd to make sure apache can start without binding issue).

So we still maintain the service stop for Debian & Ubuntu, since they
sitll provide the scripts.
Once they'll drop it, we'll drop the Service resource and deprecate
keystone::service class that will be useless.

Change-Id: Iecef6f2829ef4bf9162e77ef024d53eedf485726
"}]
commit_message:
stop managing eventlet service on RedHat

RedHat packaging dropped the eventlet service (openstack-keystone) so we
no longer need to manage it (we used to stop the service before starting
httpd to make sure apache can start without binding issue).

So we still maintain the service stop for Debian & Ubuntu, since they
sitll provide the scripts.
Once they'll drop it, we'll drop the Service resource and deprecate
keystone::service class that will be useless.

Change-Id: Iecef6f2829ef4bf9162e77ef024d53eedf485726

subject: Introduce support for oslo.messaging amqp driver configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-12 16:07:19.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp', 'spec/classes/heat_init_spec.rb', 'releasenotes/notes/add_oslo_messaging_amqp-99fc5cbd6f7af42c.yaml'], 'message': 'Introduce support for oslo.messaging amqp driver configuration

his commit adds support for the oslo.messaging amqp rpc_backend which enables
the AMQP 1.0 driver. A proposed feature for the Newton oslo.messaging release is
an update to the AMQP 1.0 driver to support a stateless messaging interconnect
for RPC traffic[1].

This patch:
* use oslo::messaging::amqp resource
* add new parameters for the oslo_messaging_amqp driver
* update spec tests for amqp as alternate rpc_backend
* add feature release note

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+spec/amqp-dispatch-router

Change-Id: I314f0f6bbba07d32f720b650b12c7bd30d07d295
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce support for oslo.messaging amqp driver configuration

his commit adds support for the oslo.messaging amqp rpc_backend which enables
the AMQP 1.0 driver. A proposed feature for the Newton oslo.messaging release is
an update to the AMQP 1.0 driver to support a stateless messaging interconnect
for RPC traffic[1].

This patch:
* use oslo::messaging::amqp resource
* add new parameters for the oslo_messaging_amqp driver
* update spec tests for amqp as alternate rpc_backend
* add feature release note

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+spec/amqp-dispatch-router

Change-Id: I314f0f6bbba07d32f720b650b12c7bd30d07d295

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-08 10:28:20.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/tests/unit/drivers/common/test_agent_callbacks.py', 'neutron_lbaas/drivers/common/agent_callbacks.py'], 'message': "Update status of members from Haproxy statistics

Member's operating status is not reflecting actual state.
For example, when the VM is is in shutdown state,
it's operating status is shown as ONLINE.

Haproxy statistics will have the current status of the servers.
Use this info to update the operating status of members.
Then user can get the operating status of members through statuses[1] Rest API.

commit_message:
Update status of members from Haproxy statistics

Member's operating status is not reflecting actual state.
For example, when the VM is is in shutdown state,
it's operating status is shown as ONLINE.

Haproxy statistics will have the current status of the servers.
Use this info to update the operating status of members.
Then user can get the operating status of members through statuses[1] Rest API.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Neutron/LBaaS/API_2.0#Retrieve_a_specific_Load_Balancer.27s_Status_Tree

Closes-bug: #1464229
Change-Id: I5a2039b754583bfc4d73fc16dd66cae1eeb3af74

commit_message:
ServiceGroup Refactoring: Add is_up to Service Obj

Add is_up method to Service object. Also remove ReadOnlyDict from
host_manager module and pass service object. This is needed in compute
filter so that host_passes method can extract service and invoke
is_up to check if the service is up or not. The new method, 'is_up',
introduced will check RPC liveness as well as servicegroup API's
service_is_up method to make sure that service is alive.

Change-Id: If792674de28c61bda6abf7230e7a7c5909567e05

commit_message:
Distinguish no existed columns in ShowOne

If we show a resource with no existed column, ShowOne command
don't raise any warning and notify that we are doing some
wrong things, the suitable behavior should be like as Lister
command, output the no recognized column names.

Change-Id: I5a698653a683c00dd3e3e41c3b381f3d4dac2c08
Closes-Bug: #1548701

At present, there are various interfaces through which services data
can  be manipulated - admin interface(nova-manage), extensions
(contrib/services.py), etc. Every interface relies on the servicegroup
layer API is_up() to get details about service live-ness. The proposal
is keep service data in nova database nova.services table and fetch
the live-ness information from the configured servicegroup(SG) driver.
Liveness will be a combination of service live-ness and RPC live-ness,
where the later will be computed based on information in nova.services.

Change-Id: I8d9aaa02b91418b64d3d8a168095d274d2e66f8b
Implements: blueprint servicegroup-api-control-plane
'}]
commit_message:
Servicegroup Foundational Refactoring

At present, there are various interfaces through which services data
can  be manipulated - admin interface(nova-manage), extensions
(contrib/services.py), etc. Every interface relies on the servicegroup
layer API is_up() to get details about service live-ness. The proposal
is keep service data in nova database nova.services table and fetch
the live-ness information from the configured servicegroup(SG) driver.
Liveness will be a combination of service live-ness and RPC live-ness,
where the later will be computed based on information in nova.services.

Change-Id: I8d9aaa02b91418b64d3d8a168095d274d2e66f8b
Implements: blueprint servicegroup-api-control-plane

commit_message:
api-ref: parameter validation for os-security-group-rules

Cleans up a bunch of the types and descriptions for the
parameters.

Removes some extraneous unused parameters.

Added descriptions for the request and response to point out
that group_id and cidr are optional but one or the other is
required and depending on what comes in the request influences
what comes back in the response.

Part of blueprint api-ref-in-rst

Change-Id: I1084fa7ec46373cc989d1d93bb667ac59a62e38a

commit_message:
Lift too strict restrictions on cross-deps role name

  Allow a user to specify any arbitrary string
  as role name for cross-deps that could be
  a regexp or a TASK_ROLE_PATTERN string

  Log a warning when task is not assigned
  to roles/groups/fields

  Set default logging level to INFO

Change-Id: I42c2490cf22f53892a189165698d1acd56ee4c74
Closes-bug: #1557997

commit_message:
Revert "allow to configure my_ip parameter"

This has broken TripleO. There is a patch[1] up to update TripleO,
but it does much more than just configure my_ip via the Puppet
module, and there is no confirmation that it has even been tested
since we can't get far enough to actually exercise Ironic to do a
deployment in CI.

[1] Ibaa55b2d4264b07faeb307893ef746ed0eb1df0c

Partial-Bug: 1581479
This reverts commit 05d474c3b219af82dcdfab7bb6bd2a6c0e6cdbcc.

Change-Id: I1db1baf6506d22c29a4e25fbe574e3df8578cb72

commit_message:
Get support matrix notes from the ini file

Currently the notes at the bottom of the support matrix are hardcoded.
This patch reads these out of the ini file to make this extension easier
to re-use in other parts of the docs.

Related to blueprint feature-classification

Change-Id: I0b2c8fbf18dd6f763cc173ff9fbabe90cbed7e0b

commit_message:
default swift_url to SERVICE_DEFAULT

If swift_url is unset, Trove will set it using the Keystone catalog.
Therefore we will default the swift_url setting to use SERVICE_DEFAULT,
so that out of the box configs will use the Keystone catalog.

Change-Id: I7a3fe361ca41fbee9f353be6e2306c1a5c7f7097

commit_message:
Add a summary of the architecture evolution work

This adds a new section describing some of the key ares we are currently
working on. Probably more importantly, it also lists the areas that we
know need attention, but currently don't have a clear plan.

Change-Id: I42f0c0056c8a35fdc54cbc119c80f934f1ee57c7

docs: split up upgrade and upgrade futures

We need better docs that look more widely at how our upgrades work,
and what promises we make to our users.

This needs to be separate from our more future direction document that
looks at some of the ways we are trying to move upgrades forward.

subject: Change Metadata Display widget to case insensitive
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-12 00:15:46.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/framework/widgets/metadata/tree/tree.service.js', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/metadata/tree/tree.spec.js'], 'message': 'Change Metadata Display widget to case insensitive

The metadata-display should match properties using case insensitive.
I've found that if you pass in extra metadata properties to
Glance v1 at create time, it takes all the properties and stores
them as lower case. So when you create an image with metadata of
FOO=BAR, it will store as foo=bar.

There are some properties "CIM_PASD_InstructionSet" that when
create at the same time as creating the image get changed to
cim_pasd_instructionset". When this gets subsequently retrieved
from Glance and displayed in the metadata-display widget,
it doesn't recognize them and won't show them.

To test, you need: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/236042/

Create an Image using the CIM Instruction Set metadata.

Go to image row and expand. You won't see the metadata.

Apply this patch git review -x 315295

Then do the same steps.  You'll see the metadata displayed:

http://imgur.com/eMfLd9H

Change-Id: I5127283e90505f3580af6afea3eb992a91b8dfc8
Closes-Bug: 1580790
'}]
commit_message:
Change Metadata Display widget to case insensitive

The metadata-display should match properties using case insensitive.
I've found that if you pass in extra metadata properties to
Glance v1 at create time, it takes all the properties and stores
them as lower case. So when you create an image with metadata of
FOO=BAR, it will store as foo=bar.

There are some properties "CIM_PASD_InstructionSet" that when
create at the same time as creating the image get changed to
cim_pasd_instructionset". When this gets subsequently retrieved
from Glance and displayed in the metadata-display widget,
it doesn't recognize them and won't show them.

To test, you need: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/236042/

Create an Image using the CIM Instruction Set metadata.

Go to image row and expand. You won't see the metadata.

Apply this patch git review -x 315295

Then do the same steps.  You'll see the metadata displayed:

http://imgur.com/eMfLd9H

Change-Id: I5127283e90505f3580af6afea3eb992a91b8dfc8
Closes-Bug: 1580790

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-09 15:03:13.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/federation/core.py', 'keystone/federation/backends/sql.py', 'keystone/federation/backends/base.py'], 'message': 'Move the federation abstract base class out of core

This patch moves the federation abstract base class out of core and into
backends/base.py

This removes dependencies where backend code references code in the
core. The reasoning being that the core should know about the backend
interface, but the backends should not know anything about the core
(separation of concerns). And part of the risk here is a potential for
circular dependencies.

Partial-Bug: #1563101

Change-Id: I3304f9c1fafe42cfe955f44224703ace82ae185a
'}]
commit_message:
Move the federation abstract base class out of core

This patch moves the federation abstract base class out of core and into
backends/base.py

This removes dependencies where backend code references code in the
core. The reasoning being that the core should know about the backend
interface, but the backends should not know anything about the core
(separation of concerns). And part of the risk here is a potential for
circular dependencies.

Partial-Bug: #1563101

Change-Id: I3304f9c1fafe42cfe955f44224703ace82ae185a

subject: Fix prettytable.PrettyTable().max_width wrong usage
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-07 16:34:25.000000000', 'files': ['cliff/formatters/table.py'], 'message': 'Fix prettytable.PrettyTable().max_width wrong usage

prettytable.PrettyTable().max_width sets *per-column* max_width
which is not what we want here. What we want to set is *total
line length*. So go through the _assign_max_widths() code that
does that for the other cases, and get it right.

Change-Id: I11b0b2ec18de8f59759f52647afba6e4ae7917c6
Signed-off-by: Vincent Legoll <vincent.legoll@idgrilles.fr>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix prettytable.PrettyTable().max_width wrong usage

prettytable.PrettyTable().max_width sets *per-column* max_width
which is not what we want here. What we want to set is *total
line length*. So go through the _assign_max_widths() code that
does that for the other cases, and get it right.

Change-Id: I11b0b2ec18de8f59759f52647afba6e4ae7917c6
Signed-off-by: Vincent Legoll <vincent.legoll@idgrilles.fr>

commit_message:
Rename tempest module

This will make clearer the fact that this module should go in
python-gnocchi-tests package for packagers.

We can't move this module in tests otherwise testr/subunit will
try to import them, and that will fail.
We could moves all tests into subdirectory to have

* tests/tempest
* tests/not_tempest

This is a ugly tests reorganisation, so this change only rename
the tempest directory into tests_tempest.

Change-Id: Ic7489421526b6fd9394a2097b397db3945c3dc3e

commit_message:
Add '--fields' to show more columns for baymodel-list

This patch adds '--fields' to 'baymodel-list' command to show more
specific fields.

Available fields for listing baymodels:
  -- uuid
  -- name
  -- coe
  -- image_id
  -- apiserver_port
  -- registry_enabled
  -- server_type
  -- public
  -- links
  -- tls_disabled

Change-Id: Ie887574d6e8a2ddda25e042317dd98c781016c80

commit_message:
Use same rsyslog config files for remote logging

The cloud-init should use the same filenames for the rsyslog remote
logging as used in the fuel-library templates which would be
overwritten during the deployment by the puppet. This is partially
fix the problem with duplicate messages sent from slave nodes to the
Fuel master node rsyslog.

Change-Id: Ib95db5545889e8ae2b86dcf787c4adb7413d5698
Partial-Bug: #1579081
Partial-Bug: #1580200
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>

subject: Disable slave repo servers while syncing
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-13 11:36:27.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/repo_server/templates/lsyncd.lua.j2', 'releasenotes/notes/disable_slave_repo_during_sync-47034c9a6a56b85d.yaml', 'playbooks/roles/repo_server/tasks/repo_pre_install.yml'], 'message': "Disable slave repo servers while syncing

Currently there is a race between the repo servers syncing and the first
role that attempts to install a pip package. This change ensures that
only the primary repo server is accessible until the slaves are synced.

This is achieved by adding a hook into lsyncd that allows a command to
be run before and after each sync. This command is an ssh command to
connect to the relevant secondary container and stop/start nginx. As the
nginx user is unprivileged, a sudoers file is added to allow nginx to be
stopped and started.

Notes on adding the hook into lsyncd:
 * There is an existing script in lsyncd/examples for postcmd. This
   works at a higher level by adding an event onto the stack for
   executing a command once the sync has finished. I experimented with
   that but events dont get fired for the initial recursive sync, only
   on subsequent changes. As it is the initial sync that causes the
   problem that this patch is addressing, I had to look at a lower level.

 * The lsync lua C lib has an exec function, but it is hidden from
   config scripts except through the spawn(...) function. However spawn
   requires an event so can't be used for the initial sync.

 * I ended up going outside the lsync framework and using lua's own
   os.execute() function for pre/post cmds.

While this looks like a big patch, its actually a relatively small
change to the default rsync script. See
https://github.com/hughsaunders/lsyncd/compare/master...hughsaunders:rsync_prepost
for a comparison.

Bug: #1543146
Co-Authored-By: Hugh Saunders <hugh@wherenow.org>
Based on commit: b457f3bda65a418884e1847759e6bfa26a7ed5ab
Change-Id: I045a4a6bf722d6f1e01d21fbbec733872acb87a5
"}]
commit_message:
Disable slave repo servers while syncing

Currently there is a race between the repo servers syncing and the first
role that attempts to install a pip package. This change ensures that
only the primary repo server is accessible until the slaves are synced.

This is achieved by adding a hook into lsyncd that allows a command to
be run before and after each sync. This command is an ssh command to
connect to the relevant secondary container and stop/start nginx. As the
nginx user is unprivileged, a sudoers file is added to allow nginx to be
stopped and started.

Notes on adding the hook into lsyncd:
 * There is an existing script in lsyncd/examples for postcmd. This
   works at a higher level by adding an event onto the stack for
   executing a command once the sync has finished. I experimented with
   that but events dont get fired for the initial recursive sync, only
   on subsequent changes. As it is the initial sync that causes the
   problem that this patch is addressing, I had to look at a lower level.

 * The lsync lua C lib has an exec function, but it is hidden from
   config scripts except through the spawn(...) function. However spawn
   requires an event so can't be used for the initial sync.

 * I ended up going outside the lsync framework and using lua's own
   os.execute() function for pre/post cmds.

While this looks like a big patch, its actually a relatively small
change to the default rsync script. See
https://github.com/hughsaunders/lsyncd/compare/master...hughsaunders:rsync_prepost
for a comparison.

Bug: #1543146
Co-Authored-By: Hugh Saunders <hugh@wherenow.org>
Based on commit: b457f3bda65a418884e1847759e6bfa26a7ed5ab
Change-Id: I045a4a6bf722d6f1e01d21fbbec733872acb87a5

revisions:

Pick function have been used to choose db related parameters
between class ::mistral and ::mistral::db, but the db related
parameters(database_idle_timeout, database_min_pool_size,
database_max_pool_size, database_max_retries,
database_retry_interval, database_max_overflow) are not defined
in ::mistral, so define them.

Change-Id: I4c9ff42d39e23c4d0268c24f6710ea46b1306385

commit_message:
Define db related parameters in class ::mistral

Pick function have been used to choose db related parameters
between class ::mistral and ::mistral::db, but the db related
parameters(database_idle_timeout, database_min_pool_size,
database_max_pool_size, database_max_retries,
database_retry_interval, database_max_overflow) are not defined
in ::mistral, so define them.

Change-Id: I4c9ff42d39e23c4d0268c24f6710ea46b1306385

subject: Stop update of volume metadata gracefully if 'os' volume is not on LVM
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-13 12:49:43.000000000', 'files': ['octane/patches/update_node_partition_info.py'], 'message': "Stop update of volume metadata gracefully if 'os' volume is not on LVM

To upgrade an OpenStack cluster node with preserved partitions and data
from version 6.0 to version 8.0, changes in disk metadata required. These
changes accommodate the metadata to change of provisioning method from
'cobbler' to 'image'.

To avoid failure if the metadata was already altered by the previous
execution of upgrade-node command, the script update_node_partition_data.py
should stop gracefully if no relevant partitions were found.

Change-Id: I7a110423312d1cd4d5101e7ce048847092d8578f
Closes-bug: 1578639
(cherry picked from commit 685241e4b7ea8b0b9150b505d435c497722680f5)
"}]
commit_message:
Stop update of volume metadata gracefully if 'os' volume is not on LVM

To upgrade an OpenStack cluster node with preserved partitions and data
from version 6.0 to version 8.0, changes in disk metadata required. These
changes accommodate the metadata to change of provisioning method from
'cobbler' to 'image'.

To avoid failure if the metadata was already altered by the previous
execution of upgrade-node command, the script update_node_partition_data.py
should stop gracefully if no relevant partitions were found.

Change-Id: I7a110423312d1cd4d5101e7ce048847092d8578f
Closes-bug: 1578639
(cherry picked from commit 685241e4b7ea8b0b9150b505d435c497722680f5)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 2537, 'name': 'Nikhil Komawar', 'email': 'nik.komawar@gmail.com', 'username': 'nikhil-komawar'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6476, 'name': 'Thomas Goirand', 'email': 'thomas@goirand.fr', 'username': 'thomas-goirand'}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-11 12:20:00.000000000', 'files': ['releasetools/release_notes.py'], 'message': 'change email topic tags based on summit feedback

At the feedback session at the Newton summit, we had feedback that
publishing release announcements under the "[release]" topic tag
cluttered up the mail being filtered by folks who need to listen for
information from the release team. Similarly, adding [stable] as a tag
to email related to stable branches makes far more email show up for
folks who need to watch for instructions from the stable team.

This patch changes "release" to "new" and removes the stable tag from
the subject line entirely. The body of the message still says when the
release is part of a stable series.

Change-Id: I5f45b9650df2edf5466cc9ea8c9dbce9c667c34c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
change email topic tags based on summit feedback

At the feedback session at the Newton summit, we had feedback that
publishing release announcements under the "[release]" topic tag
cluttered up the mail being filtered by folks who need to listen for
information from the release team. Similarly, adding [stable] as a tag
to email related to stable branches makes far more email show up for
folks who need to watch for instructions from the stable team.

This patch changes "release" to "new" and removes the stable tag from
the subject line entirely. The body of the message still says when the
release is part of a stable series.

Change-Id: I5f45b9650df2edf5466cc9ea8c9dbce9c667c34c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: tests/elements/fake-os: add '/tmp' as top level dir
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-13 01:22:01.000000000', 'files': ['tests/elements/fake-os/root.d/10-fake-os'], 'message': "tests/elements/fake-os: add '/tmp' as top level dir

lib/img-functions:finalise_base() does a recursive unmount of /tmp to
cleanup any old mounts that might be in there (we do things like bind
mount caches in there).  unmount_dir fails if /tmp isn't a
directory.

The 'run_output_format_test.sh' uses the 'fake-os' element for
testing.  Because 'fake-os' did not create the '/tmp' directory, the
test script fails.

This patch fixes the problem: it adds '/tmp' to the list of
directories that are created.

It was implemented replacing the existing five 'mkdir'
command with a for loop over now six directories.

Change-Id: Ic7aca155492967b9819f129d3843cf95e136410e
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
"}]
commit_message:
tests/elements/fake-os: add '/tmp' as top level dir

lib/img-functions:finalise_base() does a recursive unmount of /tmp to
cleanup any old mounts that might be in there (we do things like bind
mount caches in there).  unmount_dir fails if /tmp isn't a
directory.

The 'run_output_format_test.sh' uses the 'fake-os' element for
testing.  Because 'fake-os' did not create the '/tmp' directory, the
test script fails.

This patch fixes the problem: it adds '/tmp' to the list of
directories that are created.

It was implemented replacing the existing five 'mkdir'
command with a for loop over now six directories.

Change-Id: Ic7aca155492967b9819f129d3843cf95e136410e
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>

commit_message:
Add EPEL as requirement of centos-minimal

I guess I hadn't tried centos-minimal without the puppet elements that
install this for us.  But the "base" element wants dkms, which is only
in EPEL for centos.  But it's a helpful convenience so is globally
useful.

Change-Id: Ia9af97efdbd855fb8202353196ad649093788cb8

Warning messages in horizon and keystone logs regarding the 'Federated' domain
indicate that a call to get_domain is failing.

This fix will allow horizon to not attempt calls to retrieve domains

commit_message:
Bypass get_domain call to keystone api

Warning messages in horizon and keystone logs regarding the 'Federated' domain
indicate that a call to get_domain is failing.

This fix will allow horizon to not attempt calls to retrieve domains
that do not exists.  The 'Federated' domain is a virtual domain that has
no record in the keystone database.

Change-Id: Ic3225815d12472d37c4105b656c5bc75b529c359
Closes-Bug: #1557791

commit_message:
Restore fixes for partitioning schema for versions before 7.0

Partitions schema created by fuel-agent for image-based provisioning differs
from the schema used for cobbler provisioning. Cobbler provisioning was
supported in versions prior to 7.0.

If version of the environment is lower than 7.0 and provisioning method is not
image-based, fix the partitions schema at the nodes being upgraded.

Change-Id: I27a5477186efe62e3e3dc6f96b16889da1a49250
Closes-bug: 1574624
(cherry picked from commit 306321cbc924759c2cb31e6b05506f0ff22dc6da)

commit_message:
Restore fixes for partitioning schema for versions before 7.0

Partitions schema created by fuel-agent for image-based provisioning differs
from the schema used for cobbler provisioning. Cobbler provisioning was
supported in versions prior to 7.0.

If version of the environment is lower than 7.0 and provisioning method is not
image-based, fix the partitions schema at the nodes being upgraded.

Change-Id: I27a5477186efe62e3e3dc6f96b16889da1a49250
Closes-bug: 1574624
(cherry picked from commit 306321cbc924759c2cb31e6b05506f0ff22dc6da)

This proposal suggest removing Cinder drivers/plugins
from tree, in to vendor maintained repositories and pip
installable libraries published on pypi.

Note there are two proposals in the spec now, a
compromise "Option B". I'd be interested in folks
puting some thought into this and providing feedback.

This does not apply to the current reference implementation

Change-Id: I3c1279f8f9efaada9f275c6036b3710a08175bc7
'}]
commit_message:
Cinder move drivers/plugins to external libs

This proposal suggest removing Cinder drivers/plugins
from tree, in to vendor maintained repositories and pip
installable libraries published on pypi.

Note there are two proposals in the spec now, a
compromise "Option B". I'd be interested in folks
puting some thought into this and providing feedback.

This does not apply to the current reference implementation
LVM iSCSI driver.

Change-Id: I3c1279f8f9efaada9f275c6036b3710a08175bc7

commit_message:

tempest jobs are now failing. This needs to be reverted,
the devstack code fixed, then reapplied.

This reverts commit 0376abf3feb3d9f1acdfc822b633208de8f2d2fa.

subject: Introduce support for oslo.messaging amqp driver configuration
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7732, 'name': 'IvanBerezovskiy', 'email': 'ivan.berezovskii@gmail.com', 'username': 'iberezovskiy'}, {'_account_id': 7745, 'name': 'Denis Egorenko', 'email': 'degorenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'degorenko'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 20517, 'name': 'Dmitry Burmistrov', 'email': 'dmburmistrov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dmburmistrov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-05-12 18:46:40.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp', 'spec/classes/aodh_init_spec.rb', 'releasenotes/notes/add_oslo_messaging_amqp-371ec0eff31b5749.yaml'], 'message': 'Introduce support for oslo.messaging amqp driver configuration

This commit adds support for the oslo.messaging amqp rpc_backend
which enables the AMQP 1.0 driver. A proposed feature for the
Newton oslo.messaging release is an update to the AMQP 1.0 driver
to support a stateless messaging interconnect for RPC traffic [1].

This patch:
* use oslo::messaging::amqp resource
* add new parameters for the oslo_messaging_amqp driver
* update spec tests for amqp as alternate rpc_backend
* add feature release note

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+spec/amqp-dispatch-router

Change-Id: Ica192f3b5da5f02745e25b6a6b7c344dcaf7cc99
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce support for oslo.messaging amqp driver configuration

This commit adds support for the oslo.messaging amqp rpc_backend
which enables the AMQP 1.0 driver. A proposed feature for the
Newton oslo.messaging release is an update to the AMQP 1.0 driver

commit_message:
iPXE: retry on failure during introspection

Ensure iPXE retry to boot from the network in case of failure.
--timeout is required to avoid an unlimited freeze, the goto loop is
here to force iPXE to retry the download. imgfree ensure the image get
clean.

References:
 I0fbb40c711a707ae9fae186e9afbe62b79168e28
 I472dfb73044df50849c9cf72de90e59151698376
 Issue: #1326656

Change-Id: I6782f6499a8a8a9706415b3c9b22d41a9abb2e30
(cherry picked from commit 9d56010c8cfad98e6b5cc7bc097f3c148428de68)

commit_message:
iPXE: retry on failure during introspection

Ensure iPXE retry to boot from the network in case of failure.
--timeout is required to avoid an unlimited freeze, the goto loop is
here to force iPXE to retry the download. imgfree ensure the image get
clean.

References:
 I0fbb40c711a707ae9fae186e9afbe62b79168e28
 I472dfb73044df50849c9cf72de90e59151698376
 Issue: #1326656

tempest-lib is deprecated and recommends us to use tempest instead.[1]

tempest actually is not required from our repository, because when
we run tempest, it must be installed and setup firstly (at least for
now). But when we generate document for our tempest test code, it is
required, so add it to test-requirements.txt.

commit_message:
switch to tempest instead of deprecated tempest-lib

tempest-lib is deprecated and recommends us to use tempest instead.[1]

tempest actually is not required from our repository, because when
we run tempest, it must be installed and setup firstly (at least for
now). But when we generate document for our tempest test code, it is
required, so add it to test-requirements.txt.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/tempest-lib

Change-Id: Id04f5340c27cfc84f4aba4732684a73a977ccec8

commit_message:
Added keystone config to barbican api manifest

The acceptance test now has a barbican API server that runs in
a gunicorn instance that uses keystone as an authentication source.

We specify the snakeoil plugin because its a more useful and realistic
plugin to use in acceptance tests.

Fixed barbican manifest to not require including barbican::api,
and fixed typo in dogtag spec.

Added option to not autocreate the database.  This allows use of
mysql and dbsync when creating the database.

Fixed a couple of package tags.

Change-Id: I7c25f8692a4388874b05ab561602553f37e4961b
Depends-On: Ia79f3d1bed0c2a66ed17ae2ee91ca70c73f6c434
Depends-On: Ic36fd606fe06202b0ca5b8eeaf5c5bdc2a5708fd

Partitions schema created by fuel-agent for image-based provisioning differs

If version of the environment is lower than 7.0 and provisioning method is not

commit_message:
Restore fixes for partitioning schema for versions before 7.0

Partitions schema created by fuel-agent for image-based provisioning differs
from the schema used for cobbler provisioning. Cobbler provisioning was
supported in versions prior to 7.0.

If version of the environment is lower than 7.0 and provisioning method is not
image-based, fix the partitions schema at the nodes being upgraded.

Change-Id: I27a5477186efe62e3e3dc6f96b16889da1a49250
Closes-bug: 1574624

subject: Stop update of volume metadata gracefully if 'os' volume is not on LVM
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-05 13:35:31.000000000', 'files': ['octane/patches/update_node_partition_info.py'], 'message': "Stop update of volume metadata gracefully if 'os' volume is not on LVM

To upgrade an OpenStack cluster node with preserved partitions and data
from version 6.0 to version 8.0, changes in disk metadata required. These
changes accommodate the metadata to change of provisioning method from
'cobbler' to 'image'.

To avoid failure if the metadata was already altered by the previous
execution of upgrade-node command, the script update_node_partition_data.py
should stop gracefully if no relevant partitions were found.

Change-Id: I7a110423312d1cd4d5101e7ce048847092d8578f
Closes-bug: 1578639
"}]
commit_message:
Stop update of volume metadata gracefully if 'os' volume is not on LVM

To upgrade an OpenStack cluster node with preserved partitions and data
from version 6.0 to version 8.0, changes in disk metadata required. These
changes accommodate the metadata to change of provisioning method from
'cobbler' to 'image'.

To avoid failure if the metadata was already altered by the previous
execution of upgrade-node command, the script update_node_partition_data.py
should stop gracefully if no relevant partitions were found.

Change-Id: I7a110423312d1cd4d5101e7ce048847092d8578f
Closes-bug: 1578639

commit_message:

Add pep8-py34 tox test for fuel-qa branch in non-voting mode.
Later plans:

subject: Remove fix for custom field in release metadata
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-13 10:52:12.000000000', 'files': ['octane/helpers/disk.py', 'octane/commands/upgrade_node.py', 'octane/patches/update_release_partition_info.py'], 'message': "Remove fix for custom field in release metadata

Remove the script that patches custom field in the release metadata from
the code tree.

This script was requried for upgrade of customized version of 5.1.1
release of Fuel. Since that version is no longer supported, the fix
is also not used anymore.

We still need to prepare for later patching of a node's metadata by
moving other scripts and patches to the location where they are expected
to be.

Change-Id: Ifb2590f96449716db09219240ceda6738951f95b
Related-bug: 1574624
(cherry picked from commit 762d70e61d4852566386fb34e944dcae79bd6aac)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove fix for custom field in release metadata

Remove the script that patches custom field in the release metadata from
the code tree.

This script was requried for upgrade of customized version of 5.1.1
release of Fuel. Since that version is no longer supported, the fix
is also not used anymore.

We still need to prepare for later patching of a node's metadata by
moving other scripts and patches to the location where they are expected
to be.

Change-Id: Ifb2590f96449716db09219240ceda6738951f95b
Related-bug: 1574624
(cherry picked from commit 762d70e61d4852566386fb34e944dcae79bd6aac)

commit_message:
Add retries on mirror creation

Fuel-mirror can download files which it failed
to download in previous attempts.
Re-run will simply try to download absent files.

Change-Id: I54e5bbd2bac4904f6b8c1e3ce8392e170e60a1f2
Closes-bug: #1565857

"Ignoring domain related configs because identity API version is 2.0"

The warnings are present in the images test.

commit_message:
Tests: Fail if oslo.versionedobjects issues Invalid UUID warnings

There are many places in Cinder where we break this rule.

Filter them out ahead of time, before oslo.versionedobjects no
longer allows this behavior.

Change-Id: I34c48ff55a7d3e1b607fb8630bddbe5a1a14764d

commit_message:
Docs: Mandatory ssh public key

Because an id_rsa.pub is mandatory in the container generation,
this commit gives information about it in the docs.

Combined backport of:
 - dfc642c9812257172db8704c4f582e842a006696
 - bb5b306e489e13d411e27500b72ad55666f84cc0

Backport note:
This patch also includes a SHA bump for the role to bring in the
dependent patch.

Depends-On: Ifb5b23e2b472bf0c738a01acefba578754f20b4f

commit_message:
Load Mistral 'workbooks' (not 'workflows').

We are using workbooks for the most part, not workflows. The
directory name was incorrect in the
I8138d6be9a7f469d2bd520ffa2cf1ad32bc2903e so this makes things
align better.

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-09 16:59:19.000000000', 'files': ['manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/base.py', 'manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_consistency_group_actions.py', 'manila/tests/fake_share.py', 'manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/admin/test_consistency_groups.py', 'manila/tests/api/v2/test_consistency_groups.py', 'manila/api/views/consistency_groups.py', 'manila/tests/consistency_group/test_api.py', 'manila/tests/share/test_api.py', 'manila/share/api.py', 'manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/admin/test_consistency_group_actions.py', 'manila/consistency_group/api.py', 'manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_consistency_groups.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-consistency-groups-api-dd9b5b99138e22eb.yaml', 'manila/api/v2/consistency_groups.py'], 'message': 'Fix share server info in CGs created from CGs

Currently when a POST request is made to /consistency-groups
with a source cg-snapshot, the API does not register the share
network information (share_server_id and share_network_id) in
the database row newly created for the CG being created.

This information is essential to any shares that are being created
along with the consistency group.

- Disallow providing a share_network_id when using a source cg_snapshot_id
- Copy share network information from the parent CG
- Fix the share_server_id that was incorrect in the API response

 APIImpact

 Closes-Bug: #1571594
 Closes-Bug: #1572742

Change-Id: I1c3581c81e0b845f46eef3cd0acddb55850447a5
'}]
commit_message:
Fix share server info in CGs created from CGs

Currently when a POST request is made to /consistency-groups
with a source cg-snapshot, the API does not register the share
network information (share_server_id and share_network_id) in
the database row newly created for the CG being created.

This information is essential to any shares that are being created
along with the consistency group.

- Disallow providing a share_network_id when using a source cg_snapshot_id
- Copy share network information from the parent CG
- Fix the share_server_id that was incorrect in the API response

 APIImpact

 Closes-Bug: #1571594
 Closes-Bug: #1572742

Change-Id: I1c3581c81e0b845f46eef3cd0acddb55850447a5

commit_message:
Correct parameter order for assertEqual() method

Per 'TestCase.assertEqual' method definition[1], the parameter
sequence should be assertEqual(self, expected, observed, message='').

This commit fix the wrong parameter order(observed, expected) of
assertEqual method in magnum/tests/functional/api/v1/test_bay.py[2]

[1]https://github.com/testing-cabal/testtools/blob/master/testtools/testcase.py#L398
[2]https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/magnum/tests/functional/api/v1/test_bay.py#L95

Change-Id: Iece9606ff16b1620149d4dda1022554287ec150c

The tutorials still use the old style class declaration.
class MyTable(DataTable):
    name = Column('name')
    email = Column('email')

    class Meta:

commit_message:
Tutorials related to class Meta should use new style

The tutorials still use the old style class declaration.
class MyTable(DataTable):
    name = Column('name')
    email = Column('email')

    class Meta:
        name = "my_table"
        table_actions = (MyAction, MyOtherAction)
        row_actions - (MyAction)
It should use new style (inherit from 'object').

Change-Id: Icad23f6359f5f4866c5819f351f5c5cf1c3521fd
closes-bug:#1564193

commit_message:

Should fix tox-db-new_arch failure in the following patches
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/280793/11

subject: Remove fix for custom field in release metadata
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-12 13:06:09.000000000', 'files': ['octane/helpers/disk.py', 'octane/commands/upgrade_node.py', 'octane/patches/update_release_partition_info.py'], 'message': "Remove fix for custom field in release metadata

Remove the script that patches custom field in the release metadata from
the code tree.

This script was requried for upgrade of customized version of 5.1.1
release of Fuel. Since that version is no longer supported, the fix
is also not used anymore.

We still need to prepare for later patching of a node's metadata by
moving other scripts and patches to the location where they are expected
to be.

Change-Id: Ifb2590f96449716db09219240ceda6738951f95b
Related-bug: 1574624
"}]
commit_message:
Remove fix for custom field in release metadata

Remove the script that patches custom field in the release metadata from
the code tree.

This script was requried for upgrade of customized version of 5.1.1
release of Fuel. Since that version is no longer supported, the fix
is also not used anymore.

We still need to prepare for later patching of a node's metadata by
moving other scripts and patches to the location where they are expected
to be.

Change-Id: Ifb2590f96449716db09219240ceda6738951f95b
Related-bug: 1574624

subject: Purge deleted /etc/hosts entries for deleted ndoes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-12 17:20:27.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/hosts/hosts.pp', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/hosts/hosts_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/hiera/hiera.pp', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/astute/tasks.yaml'], 'message': 'Purge deleted /etc/hosts entries for deleted ndoes

Deleted nodes now will get stored in a file
/etc/hiera/deleted_nodes.yaml and be inserted into
the hiera hierarchy.

host entries for any records present in deleted_nodes.yaml
will be purged when evaluating hosts task.

The source YAML for deleted nodes is generated on master
because nodes that are deployed from scratch or from Error
state will not be able to identify deleted nodes due to
certain orchestration limitations.

Change-Id: I01db215e77a3532a6fa7bf46ab7e20e281e8c165
Closes-Bug: #1513401
(cherry picked from commit eacb493e38a31747dc61a43a081adf00adbeb8eb)
'}]
commit_message:
Purge deleted /etc/hosts entries for deleted ndoes

Deleted nodes now will get stored in a file
/etc/hiera/deleted_nodes.yaml and be inserted into
the hiera hierarchy.

host entries for any records present in deleted_nodes.yaml
will be purged when evaluating hosts task.

The source YAML for deleted nodes is generated on master
because nodes that are deployed from scratch or from Error
state will not be able to identify deleted nodes due to
certain orchestration limitations.

Change-Id: I01db215e77a3532a6fa7bf46ab7e20e281e8c165
Closes-Bug: #1513401
(cherry picked from commit eacb493e38a31747dc61a43a081adf00adbeb8eb)

commit_message:
Use new microversion header

per API WG guidline
If3fa2f85c5771b589992ac374ad26626abc9b13c

to send microversion header.

I9098ab8f0800fb0550887f5eff219b18addde709

Change-Id: I3944d644373535a1966f24fb82da780b75f23221

If "auth_type" is empty then keystone middleware
uses deprecated auth_plugin for authentication.
That one is not desirable and it's not configured.
This patch properly configures authentication.

commit_message:
Configure "keystone_authtoken" for glance re-authentication

If "auth_type" is empty then keystone middleware
uses deprecated auth_plugin for authentication.
That one is not desirable and it's not configured.
This patch properly configures authentication.
It affects Glance API.

Closes-bug: #1576035

Change-Id: Iedcae152c9bc3cfb6a85d5d72aeb97e3c6e4a2d1

floods the log. The update is the largest offender out of the

commit_message:
Update log levels

When scaling to a large stack the start/update/abort log message
floods the log. The update is the largest offender out of the
three. Switching these messages to debug to minimize this.

Change-Id: I757d368a1b54491cc6f3c1c7fa8d8b8b763c1e72

commit_message:
Purge deleted /etc/hosts entries for deleted ndoes

Deleted nodes now will get stored in a file
/etc/hiera/deleted_nodes.yaml and be inserted into
the hiera hierarchy.

host entries for any records present in deleted_nodes.yaml
will be purged when evaluating hosts task.

The source YAML for deleted nodes is generated on master
because nodes that are deployed from scratch or from Error
state will not be able to identify deleted nodes due to
certain orchestration limitations.

Change-Id: I01db215e77a3532a6fa7bf46ab7e20e281e8c165
Closes-Bug: #1513401

commit_message:
Display min/max correctly from config-param-list

When you run 'trove configuration-parameter-list' the CLI displays a
table without any values in the 'min_size' and 'max_size' fields.

The values now display correctly, and missing ones are represented
by '-' (in the case of string parameters).

Change-Id: Ib3a006aba4524e8e2fd4293449c54ee9d1dcabd1
Closes-Bug: #1572272

subject: Add ceilometer messaging_url for each service...
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-01-27 14:28:44.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_ceilometer/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_ceilometer/templates/ceilometer.conf.j2', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/hosts.yml'], 'message': "Add ceilometer messaging_url for each service...

Without specifying messaging_urls, ceilometer only listens on the vhost
specified in the rabbit configuration directives.
To align with the the default OSA architecture, which isolates each service
into it's own respective rabbitmq vhost, this patchset has added jinja code
in the ceilometer.conf.j2 template to specifiy a messaging_url for each service,
 and for each service, each rabbitmq host. This ensures ceilometer is spawning
the correct number of listeners on the correct vhost and consuming notifications
correctly.

In addition, a few small changes were made in the patch set:

* store_events is now True by default
* rabbitmq_userid and rabbitmq_vhost service variables have been moved to group_vars.

Backports included:

* https://review.openstack.org/267112

Closes-Bug: #1526457
(cherry picked from commit f4757d65745ac7f3c04beb6d0a3dd9125f81717a)
(cherry picked from commit 210012da415de74a979c4337e0f26e5450fd6a72)

Conflicts:
	playbooks/inventory/group_vars/hosts.yml
	playbooks/roles/os_ceilometer/defaults/main.yml
	playbooks/roles/os_ceilometer/templates/ceilometer.conf.j2

Change-Id: If246d00979d712ab8cb62ac93b57ff22a8487dee
"}]
commit_message:
Add ceilometer messaging_url for each service...

Without specifying messaging_urls, ceilometer only listens on the vhost
specified in the rabbit configuration directives.
To align with the the default OSA architecture, which isolates each service
into it's own respective rabbitmq vhost, this patchset has added jinja code
in the ceilometer.conf.j2 template to specifiy a messaging_url for each service,
 and for each service, each rabbitmq host. This ensures ceilometer is spawning
the correct number of listeners on the correct vhost and consuming notifications
correctly.

In addition, a few small changes were made in the patch set:

* store_events is now True by default
* rabbitmq_userid and rabbitmq_vhost service variables have been moved to group_vars.

Backports included:

* https://review.openstack.org/267112

Closes-Bug: #1526457
(cherry picked from commit f4757d65745ac7f3c04beb6d0a3dd9125f81717a)
(cherry picked from commit 210012da415de74a979c4337e0f26e5450fd6a72)

Conflicts:
	playbooks/inventory/group_vars/hosts.yml
	playbooks/roles/os_ceilometer/defaults/main.yml
	playbooks/roles/os_ceilometer/templates/ceilometer.conf.j2

Change-Id: If246d00979d712ab8cb62ac93b57ff22a8487dee

subject: Extract redundant time field from pool in runner
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-11 10:16:23.000000000', 'files': ['rally/plugins/common/runners/constant.py'], 'message': 'Extract redundant time field from pool in runner

Currently we are putting to the pool in the worker proccess in constant
runner tuple where first is the thread second is time.time(). Now its
redundant here and looks like rudiment.

Delete it therefore simplify indexing in the code.

Change-Id: I9af720027254b86d7a72671bd559f4eb5553d4bd
'}]
commit_message:
Extract redundant time field from pool in runner

Currently we are putting to the pool in the worker proccess in constant
runner tuple where first is the thread second is time.time(). Now its
redundant here and looks like rudiment.

Delete it therefore simplify indexing in the code.

Change-Id: I9af720027254b86d7a72671bd559f4eb5553d4bd

commit_message:
Fix snapshot test uuid warnings in api.contrib

This commit fixes invalid uuid usage in the various
snapshot unit tests under cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib,
cleaning up FutureWarnings from oslo_versioned_objects [1].

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.versionedobjects/api/fields.html#oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField

Change-Id: Ic3be860fd18ef8dedfa04adb07952495b7a8b422

commit_message:
Set endpoint_override while doing session.request

The recent refactor broke multi-region deployments by not using
endpoint_override when doing _http_request in SessionClient.
This change fixes it.

Closes-bug: #1557105
Change-Id: I99cbcd34eeec1388a00d1a0d910dd5759191f954
(cherry picked from commit c9dc5faf20f7f41cbf16dd05f1b336e69b223196)

subject: MySQL OCF RA to not chose all-zero-uuid as possible masters
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-12 21:04:34.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/mysql-wss'], 'message': 'MySQL OCF RA to not chose all-zero-uuid as possible masters

Select possible masters from nodes with non zero uuids and fall back
to zero ids if only no more meaningfull ids were found.

For example, if 4 nodes have 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000,
and 5th has ef3c5d28-1045-11e6-941c-82b1df28ba4c, chose the latter
and ignore a majority of zero uuids. Otherwise, the possible master
may not be always found as crm_simulate may return negative score
for all candidates with zero ids.

Fuel-CI: disable

Related-bug: #1576244

Change-Id: I0a5108cb6ceb6ef869d89f4993897390c8f4c749
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 52b12dab712e35b91eccab8190b48d4cdf80f52c)
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>
'}]
commit_message:
MySQL OCF RA to not chose all-zero-uuid as possible masters

Select possible masters from nodes with non zero uuids and fall back
to zero ids if only no more meaningfull ids were found.

For example, if 4 nodes have 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000,
and 5th has ef3c5d28-1045-11e6-941c-82b1df28ba4c, chose the latter
and ignore a majority of zero uuids. Otherwise, the possible master
may not be always found as crm_simulate may return negative score
for all candidates with zero ids.

Fuel-CI: disable

Related-bug: #1576244

Change-Id: I0a5108cb6ceb6ef869d89f4993897390c8f4c749
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 52b12dab712e35b91eccab8190b48d4cdf80f52c)
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Fix OCF MySQL monitor

Return success if SST detected, otherwise check status
and return error if it is not OK.

Closes-bug: #1574999

Change-Id: I5ee7807821ae1f21bcb3c74e15338acb8bb91ea1
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-12 21:04:34.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/mysql-wss'], 'message': 'Rework SST check, fix possible masters search

* Fix racing of monitoring with SST
* Fix printf multilines sorting
  Expected:  printf -- '%s\n' ${a} | sort -u (returns a sorted multiline)
  Actuacl: printf -- '%s\n' "$a" | sort -u (returns a single string)

commit_message:
Rework SST check, fix possible masters search

* Fix racing of monitoring with SST
* Fix printf multilines sorting
  Expected:  printf -- '%s\n' ${a} | sort -u (returns a sorted multiline)
  Actuacl: printf -- '%s\n' "$a" | sort -u (returns a single string)
* Fix possible masters search, by the greatest SEQNO found for a
  magority UUID
(Those blocks each other in CI and must be fixed at once)

Fuel-CI: disable

Closes-bug: #1574999
Closes-bug: #1578278
Closes-bug: #1388779

Change-Id: I3d0d376e6bef3ccc3e738731b71f4dd60a59e653
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 03991059adcc99989431c27f38c5ffa4ae35b486)
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Ide4b43f71f74431fa8017ea05c9ea52c05b96a32

commit_message:
Fix possible masters search

OCF RA shall not evaluate "0" UUIDs.
Fix getting UUID by including "wsrep_start_position" as well.

Fuel-CI: disable

Closes-bug: #1576244

Change-Id: Ide4b43f71f74431fa8017ea05c9ea52c05b96a32
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

subject: Always expand Baymodel fields
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-12 18:39:22.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/api/controllers/v1/baymodel.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_baymodel.py'], 'message': 'Always expand Baymodel fields

In baymodel (https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/magnum/
api/controllers/v1/baymodel.py), we have an unset exception list:

            baymodel.unset_fields_except(['uuid', 'name', 'image_id',
                                          'apiserver_port', 'coe'])

In order for the new "--fields" option [1] to work better, this patch will
remove the expand option so that all fields are included by default.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/286950/

Change-Id: I1adffca9a7c6e013bed38530036dfc0aed918fdc
Closes-Bug: #1579236
'}]
commit_message:
Always expand Baymodel fields

In baymodel (https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/magnum/
api/controllers/v1/baymodel.py), we have an unset exception list:

            baymodel.unset_fields_except(['uuid', 'name', 'image_id',
                                          'apiserver_port', 'coe'])

In order for the new "--fields" option [1] to work better, this patch will
remove the expand option so that all fields are included by default.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/286950/

Change-Id: I1adffca9a7c6e013bed38530036dfc0aed918fdc
Closes-Bug: #1579236

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-11-06 16:10:57.000000000', 'files': ['nova/image/glance.py', 'nova/tests/unit/image/test_glance.py'], 'message': 'glance:add helper method to get client version

This patch adds a new method in nova/image/glance.py called
_determine_curr_major_version. This helper method shall add
the capability to obtain the current version of the glance API
in use instead of hardcoding the client version in the nova
code. There is no attempt made at this point to replace any
code to use this helper method. However, it shall be used at
various places inside the module to replace the hardcoding of
the glance client version in a few forthcoming patches.

Related to blueprint use-glance-v2-api

Co-Authored-By: Mike Fedosin <mfedosin@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I5a29e99fa10ae20a739c4846be8eb125a3761e48
'}]
commit_message:
glance:add helper method to get client version

This patch adds a new method in nova/image/glance.py called
_determine_curr_major_version. This helper method shall add
the capability to obtain the current version of the glance API
in use instead of hardcoding the client version in the nova
code. There is no attempt made at this point to replace any
code to use this helper method. However, it shall be used at
various places inside the module to replace the hardcoding of
the glance client version in a few forthcoming patches.

Related to blueprint use-glance-v2-api

Co-Authored-By: Mike Fedosin <mfedosin@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I5a29e99fa10ae20a739c4846be8eb125a3761e48

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-10 06:55:45.000000000', 'files': ['midonet/neutron/db/l2gateway_midonet.py', 'midonet/neutron/services/l2gateway/common/l2gw_midonet_validators.py', 'midonet/neutron/services/l2gateway/plugin.py', 'midonet/neutron/tests/unit/test_extension_l2gateway.py', 'midonet/neutron/services/l2gateway/service_drivers/l2gw_midonet.py'], 'message': 'Allow segmentation id over vlan in L2GW Connection

Though using gateway device of vtep router, segmentation id over vlan is
not accepted in l2-gateway-connection by validation on upstream code.
This patch avoids its validation and allows vxlan range segmentaion id.

Change-Id: I24c8271ba2ae3c670d78b43c3fecaa98f900b46d
Closes-bug: #1572408
'}]
commit_message:
Allow segmentation id over vlan in L2GW Connection

Though using gateway device of vtep router, segmentation id over vlan is
not accepted in l2-gateway-connection by validation on upstream code.
This patch avoids its validation and allows vxlan range segmentaion id.

Change-Id: I24c8271ba2ae3c670d78b43c3fecaa98f900b46d
Closes-bug: #1572408

commit_message:
Improve example of project acting as a domain

The current project example in the project entity section was,
in fact, invalid - it showed a project acting as a domain that
was not at the top of the tree. This patch corrects this and adds
correct examples of a project acting as a domain and a top level
regular project.

Change-Id: I2b0519f3c0ea274898ffd2ed6cad24c6b4352940

revisions:

For publishing tinyipa from stable/branches we need to be able to place
branch references into the files created so that when they are uploaded
versions from different branches do not conflict. This change also adds
building a tar for publishing too.

Change-Id: I9d879689c8e88768aaa96d0033b62d062f9cdc27
(cherry picked from commit 90156c006db181634114e3acdf90885062a0aba5)

commit_message:
Enable branch tagging during tinyipa build

For publishing tinyipa from stable/branches we need to be able to place
branch references into the files created so that when they are uploaded
versions from different branches do not conflict. This change also adds
building a tar for publishing too.

Change-Id: I9d879689c8e88768aaa96d0033b62d062f9cdc27
(cherry picked from commit 90156c006db181634114e3acdf90885062a0aba5)

subject: Add 'fault' flavor to test persisting an error msg
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-11 21:28:52.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/conf/mariadb.conf', 'scripts/conf/test_begin.conf', 'scripts/redstack'], 'message': "Add 'fault' flavor to test persisting an error msg

In order to test that error messages are now persisted,
a method of guaranteeing that a Trove create command
will fail is needed.  The simplest way to do that is to
attempt to allocate more resources from Nova than it
has available.  To this effect, a 'fault' flavor has
been added.

Also bumped up the disk on mariadb to handle more
operating systems.

Change-Id: I32a5ed229988f047db44183c71f0462fa6f1990d
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'fault' flavor to test persisting an error msg

In order to test that error messages are now persisted,
a method of guaranteeing that a Trove create command
will fail is needed.  The simplest way to do that is to
attempt to allocate more resources from Nova than it
has available.  To this effect, a 'fault' flavor has
been added.

Also bumped up the disk on mariadb to handle more
operating systems.

Change-Id: I32a5ed229988f047db44183c71f0462fa6f1990d

commit_message:
Add _member_ role to Swift operator list

Newly created users unable to interract with Swift by default,
to fix this, we need to add _member_ role to Swift operator list.

Change-Id: Ia4a2ab35efa0e4304b9aba39d59c643848aa123e
Closes-Bug: #1561241
(cherry picked from commit 6c8d10130b7658b733d7b56ea54cc7933a9f5857)

commit_message:
Fix huge pages related opts behavior

Make sure that $hugepages_1g_opts_ensure is always set as a case is possible
when this variable is not set, file_line will treate it as 'present'

Change-Id: I1b89195564ee41e8b04833bdb131d7e3a7f7f089
Closes-bug: #1578623
(cherry picked from commit c7e6902d5be53c125cd69597cea46454efba7260)

Fix neutron metadata protocol with selective TLS

VMs dont receive metadata when selective TLS is used for nova endpoints.

Closes-bug: 1571063

commit_message:
Fix typo in ceph-osd YAQL expression

This is a simple one-line fix to fix a typo in YAQL expression
for ceph-osd: values should be a function call instead of attribute
fetching.

Change-Id: I20d7e3b00b371e86bef9b17b6b4c343db271fbe3
Closes-bug: #1578584
(cherry picked from commit 707ca5ea1c7eb911a885b77ad13b020091551a7a)

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-04-19 08:05:23.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/agents_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_agents_db.py'], 'message': "Don't log warning for missing resource_versions

Since mitaka, agents can send a new report about the resource versions
they know about, and subscribe via rpc callback push mechanisms.
Some agents don't depend on versioned objects via push, and therefore
don't need to update neutron-server about such details, anyway server
side was complaining when that dictionary was missing on the state
report.

This patch avoids the warning log for missing 'resource_versions'
field in the agent status report.

Change-Id: Ief5186871515a5700afb56ac5e3fe493b4a05e8e
Closes-Bug: 1571544
"}]
commit_message:
Don't log warning for missing resource_versions

Since mitaka, agents can send a new report about the resource versions
they know about, and subscribe via rpc callback push mechanisms.
Some agents don't depend on versioned objects via push, and therefore
don't need to update neutron-server about such details, anyway server
side was complaining when that dictionary was missing on the state
report.

This patch avoids the warning log for missing 'resource_versions'
field in the agent status report.

Change-Id: Ief5186871515a5700afb56ac5e3fe493b4a05e8e
Closes-Bug: 1571544

commit_message:
Update XStatic-MDI

A new version of XStatic-mdi was released on PyPI[1].

- Remove the strict requirement ("==") from requirements.txt, so that we
  can consume future package updates.
- Move minimum to 1.4.57.0, as Horizon uses icons from this set.

1. https://pypi.python.org/pypi/XStatic-mdi

subject: [zmq] Add backend ROUTER to increase bandwidth
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-10 11:55:45.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/zmq_driver/server/consumers/zmq_dealer_consumer.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/zmq_driver/broker/zmq_queue_proxy.py', 'oslo_messaging/_cmd/zmq_proxy.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/zmq_driver/client/publishers/zmq_publisher_base.py'], 'message': '[zmq] Add backend ROUTER to increase bandwidth

As for zmq we have a native thread running per each
zmq socket to perform async send/receive. Bandwidth
should increase by adding one more ROUTER socket to proxy.
We can not add more because it will increase the number
of connections, but with FE and BE sockets number of
connections will stay the same as with a single ROUTER,
because all clients will connect to FE, and all servers
will connect to BE.

Change-Id: Ib1f070a503272164ec0e9c28ce20530cfa6b79aa
'}]
commit_message:
[zmq] Add backend ROUTER to increase bandwidth

As for zmq we have a native thread running per each
zmq socket to perform async send/receive. Bandwidth
should increase by adding one more ROUTER socket to proxy.
We can not add more because it will increase the number
of connections, but with FE and BE sockets number of
connections will stay the same as with a single ROUTER,
because all clients will connect to FE, and all servers
will connect to BE.

Change-Id: Ib1f070a503272164ec0e9c28ce20530cfa6b79aa

Implements two APIs that enables os-brick APIs involving volume
path querying to be used.

* get-volume-paths
    - Get the volume paths associated with a specific volume.

* get-all-volume-paths
    - Get all the volume paths on a system for a specified
      connector protocol.

These APIs are of use in a testing or developement environment
when many attach and detach operations are being done and
verification of proper functionality is desired.

Based off of an os-brick patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/204191/

Change-Id: If47eac294ea210e994482d642a900d2c64e72a49
'}]
commit_message:
Query volume paths implementation

Implements two APIs that enables os-brick APIs involving volume
path querying to be used.

* get-volume-paths
    - Get the volume paths associated with a specific volume.

* get-all-volume-paths
    - Get all the volume paths on a system for a specified
      connector protocol.

These APIs are of use in a testing or developement environment
when many attach and detach operations are being done and
verification of proper functionality is desired.

Based off of an os-brick patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/204191/

Change-Id: If47eac294ea210e994482d642a900d2c64e72a49

When swift disks fill up completely it becomes difficult to perform
operations since delete operations require a write.

By setting this value we can ensure that PUT requests won't happen when
the disk space is below the threshold set (in bytes). This will not
govern rsyncs, which can still happen to fill up the disks, but assuming
a reasonably uniform distribution of data this should help prevent disks
from filling up.

Change-Id: I753de5e5ed09a21571575ef51c38752edc0730cb
Closes-Bug: #1545018
(cherry picked from commit 81aecda55fd612ff095f1546521b48dd0216ffbd)
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Expose and set a default fallocate_reserve value

When swift disks fill up completely it becomes difficult to perform
operations since delete operations require a write.

By setting this value we can ensure that PUT requests won't happen when
the disk space is below the threshold set (in bytes). This will not
govern rsyncs, which can still happen to fill up the disks, but assuming
a reasonably uniform distribution of data this should help prevent disks
from filling up.

Change-Id: I753de5e5ed09a21571575ef51c38752edc0730cb
Closes-Bug: #1545018
(cherry picked from commit 81aecda55fd612ff095f1546521b48dd0216ffbd)
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Dell SC: find_volume failure in manage and retype

The find_volume function gained an optional parameter and then
that paramter became not optional. Not all references were found.

This fixes that.

Change-Id: I59187c12c7ba1ace4f04ca3e65c906b33327e916
Closes-Bug: #1579860

commit_message:
Modify an option for delete-port as recovery

When create_port failed on add_router_interface, it fails to delete
the port. On error recovery path, l3_port_check=False should be passed
to delete_port().

Partial-bug: #1525163
Co-Authored-By: Yushiro FURUKAWA <y.furukawa_2@jp.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I5f83c99aaa2ebc061630a8382fe98e4460e7f620

Fix uuid warnings from api.contrib backup tests

This commit fixes invalid uuid usage in the backup unit tests
under cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib, cleaning up FutureWarnings
from oslo_versioned_objects [1].
